meanings.definition: To sign (a document) in addition to the original signature in order to confirm its authenticity.
meanings.sent1: She countersigned the contract to make sure it was real.
meanings.sent2: The manager countersigned the approval on the form.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to countersign the dog's pawprint on the paper.
meanings.sent4: His laughter countersigned his joy in the moment.
meanings.sent5: The bright red stamp countersigned the official document.

meanings.definition: A signature added to a document in addition to the original signature to confirm its authenticity.
meanings.sent1: The countersigned stamp indicated the document's validity.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the countersigned section at the bottom of the page.
meanings.sent3: The countersigned signature looked like a secret code on the paper.
meanings.sent4: The countersigned mark stood out among the other signatures.
meanings.sent5: The countersigned symbol added an extra layer of security to the contract.
